channel.title: OpenGL Linux
channel.description:
Basically, OpenGL doesn't seem to be working for me when I try to use it on RuneScape.
I did glxinfo: [code]OpenGL vendor string: DRI R300 Project OpenGL renderer string: Mesa DRI R300 (RV515 7183) 20090101 x86/MMX/SSE2 TCL DRI2 OpenGL version string: 1.5 Mesa 7.9-devel[/code] So it appears OpenGL [i]should[/i] be working, but whenever I change my RS settings to OpenGL, the canvas turns white and wont do anything else (I need to refresh my browser)
It's probably something stupid, but help is appreciated.

item.title: OpenGL Linux
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:387525”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=483327.msg3540192#msg3540192 date=1300816624]
Basically, OpenGL doesn’t seem to be working for me when I try to use it on RuneScape.

I did glxinfo:

OpenGL vendor string: DRI R300 Project OpenGL renderer string: Mesa DRI R300 (RV515 7183) 20090101 x86/MMX/SSE2 TCL DRI2 OpenGL version string: 1.5 Mesa 7.9-devel So it appears OpenGL should be working, but whenever I change my RS settings to OpenGL, the canvas turns white and wont do anything else (I need to refresh my browser)

It’s probably something stupid, but help is appreciated.
[/quote]

The Mesa driver provides OpenGL support in software, ie not hardware-accelerated. What video card do you have? You should install the drivers for it.[/quote]Yea I figured it was my drivers. I’m installing what I think is the proper driver software, I guess we shall see after I restart

Read full topic

item.title: OpenGL Linux
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:1, topic:387525”]Basically, OpenGL doesn’t seem to be working for me when I try to use it on RuneScape.

I did glxinfo:

OpenGL vendor string: DRI R300 Project OpenGL renderer string: Mesa DRI R300 (RV515 7183) 20090101 x86/MMX/SSE2 TCL DRI2 OpenGL version string: 1.5 Mesa 7.9-devel So it appears OpenGL should be working, but whenever I change my RS settings to OpenGL, the canvas turns white and wont do anything else (I need to refresh my browser)

It’s probably something stupid, but help is appreciated.[/quote]

The Mesa driver provides OpenGL support in software, ie not hardware-accelerated. What video card do you have? You should install the drivers for it.

Read full topic

item.title: OpenGL Linux
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

cumescape:

What you are referring to as “Linux” is actually GNU+Linux.

Have you always been so obnoxious, or have you just started recently? Stallman isn’t worth his weight in shit, which is why people cleverly omit his organisation’s ties with linux in the name.
This allows Linus Torvalds to be the face of open source, and not Stallman.

[quote=“Unhandled, post:6, topic:387525”][quote author=cumescape link=topic=483327.msg3540337#msg3540337 date=1300822292]
What you are referring to as “Linux” is actually GNU+Linux.
[/quote]
fuck off stallman[/quote]

Read full topic
